de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.facade

Class BeagleConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.facade.BeagleConfiguration

  • public class BeagleConfiguration
extends Object
    Configures a whole execution of Beagle. Therefore contains all values needed to set up Beagle. The class defines meaningful default values for all its settings.

    The configuration has two states: A set up state, during which values may be modified and a finalised state, in which the configuration is immutable and can only be used to obtain values. The transition from the set up state to the finalised state is done through finalise(). The inverse transition is not possible. Trying to perform an action that is not allowed for the momentary state results in an IllegalStateException being thrown.

        public BeagleConfiguration(List<org.palladiosimulator.pcm.core.entity.Entity> elements,
                           File repositoryFile,
                           org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaProject javaProject)
        Constructs a new BeagleConfiguration using elements as the default elements to be measured.
        Parameters:
        elements - The elements to be measured or null to indicate that everything in repositoryFile should be analysed.
        repositoryFile - The repository file to use. Must not be null.
        javaProject - the IJavaProject to analyse. Must not be null.

      • getElements

        public List<org.palladiosimulator.pcm.core.entity.Entity> getElements()
        Returns the elements to be measured or null to indicate that everything in the repository file should be analysed.
        Returns:
        The elements to be measured or null to indicate that everything in the repository file should be analysed.

      • setElements

        public void setElements(List<org.palladiosimulator.pcm.core.entity.Entity> elements)
        Sets the elements to be measured to elements. null indicates that everything in the repository file should be analysed. This operation is only allowed in the set up state.
        Parameters:
        elements - The elements to be measured or null to indicate that everything in the repository file should be analysed.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this configuration is not in the set up state.
        See Also:
        getElements()

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Returns the timeout to be used. The timeout describes the minimum time Beagle shall keep trying to find results while no perfect results were found.
        timeout value description
        ADAPTIVE_TIMEOUTBeagle will use a timeout that adapts to the quality of the analysis’ findings in the past.
        NO_TIMEOUTno timeout will be used
        ≥ 0the given value will be used as a fixed timeout in seconds
        Returns:
        The timeout that will be used by Beagle.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the timeout to be used to timeout. The timeout describes the minimum time Beagle shall keep trying to find results while no perfect results were found. This operation is only allowed in the set up state.
        timeout value description
        ADAPTIVE_TIMEOUTBeagle will use a timeout that adapts to the quality of the analysis’ findings in the past.
        NO_TIMEOUTno timeout will be used
        ≥ 0the given value will be used as a fixed timeout in seconds
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout to be used by Beagle.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this configuration is not in the set up state.

      • getRepositoryFile

        public File getRepositoryFile()
        Returns the repository file that contains all elements that shall be analysed.
        Returns:
        The repository file Beagle will operate on.

      • setRepositoryFile

        public void setRepositoryFile(File repositoryFile)
        Sets the repository file containing the elements Beagle shall analyse. This operation is only allowed in the set up state.
        Parameters:
        repositoryFile - The pcm repository file containing all elements Beagle shall analyse. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this configuration is not in the set up state.

      • isFinal

        public boolean isFinal()
        Queries whether this configuration is in the finalised state.
        Returns:
        true if this configuration is in the finalised state, false if it’s in the set up state.

      • finalise

        public void finalise()
        Finalises this configuration, thus transitioning it into the finalised state. Calling this method when this configuration already is in the finalised state has no effect.
